alert.note: Alert for Eastern Grant; Eastern Mineral; Eastern Pendleton; Hampshire; Hardy; Western Mineral (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 4:49PM EST until January 16 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Portions of western Virginia and eastern West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow intensity will increase this evening before tapering off late tonight. Wind chills will also hover between 5 above to 5 degrees below zero, especially in the higher elevations.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Grant; Eastern Mineral; Eastern Pendleton; Hampshire; Hardy; Western Mineral
